result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Paul C Haberman was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
2nd amended criminal complaint

Defendant Paul C Haberman in court with Attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files a 2nd amended criminal complaint.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1 on 2nd amended criminal complaint.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on 2nd amended criminal complaint.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  Count #3 is dismissed by operation of law.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  James D. makes statements.  Paula H. makes statements.  Attorney Huppertz makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  HUBER:  210 days (1 day credit), Release for work, treatment to commence forthwith - Consecutive to 15CT686.  Defendant taken in to custody. 

FINE: $2,379.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted-remainder to be refunded to poster (after 15CT686 is paid))

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to New Berlin Police Department. 

** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

DL REVOCATION:  30 months

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 30 months

Victim Impact Panel on:  11/18/15. Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH

As posted on 5/11/2015.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report immediately after court today.
